author: Reuters Editorial
title: North Korea's Kim will 'open-heartedly' discuss issues with South Korean leader: KCNA
text:
(Reuters) - North Korean leader Kim Jong Un left Pyongyang for his summit with South Korean President Moon Jae-in on Friday, where he will “open-heartedly” discuss issues of peace, prosperity and reunification, North Korean state news agency KCNA said.
Students hold posters with pictures of South Korea's President Moon Jae-in and North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un during a pro-unification rally ahead of the upcoming summit between North and South Korea in Seoul, South Korea April 26, 2018. REUTERS/Jorge Silva “Kim Jong Un will open-heartedly discuss with Moon Jae In all the issues arising in improving inter-Korean relations and achieving peace, prosperity and reunification of the Korean peninsula,” KCNA said.
Reporting by Eric Beech in Washington; Editing by Lisa Lambert
